to diagnose a specific problem and then the second part of it is collecting really high quality data

what we do here is we can do dynamic log configuration which does not require a software update
so you can literally change the data that you're collecting from your fleet
on a second notice for an entire fleet of millions of vehicles deployed across the globe and change the

you know constantly refine what data you're collecting instead of just collecting data all the

every vehicle so in the case of vehicle a it's running version 1.1 but has a

are shown in green because they're already on the same on the right version of software because
there was no change between version 1.1 and 1.2 but the tpms
and the battery management system app did change so those are the only two
pieces that are downloaded and applied to that vehicle and once that is done the vehicle
moves as a whole to version 1.2 so in the other example with vehicle
beat it has some other hardware and the bcm and the gateway are the same
but now the tpms changed and the infotainment unit changed so this this vehicle is maybe a
higher end vehicle and has an infotainment unit and that needs a new software version so only those pieces
are downloaded for that vehicle and this mechanism essentially allows us
to have what we call a menu and order concept so the menu is the full package that is
available on the cloud anything within that package is self-consistent right so it can be
deployed to any vehicle that it applies to but the vehicle then
chooses from the menu and orders the items that are relevant for it and brings that
down to the vehicle so that's kind of how the software update flow works and this helps reduce complexity
with managing different packages for each vehicle so you can have one universal package
